headline: Southwest price target raised to $44 from $38 at Citi
summary: Citi raised the firm’s price target on Southwest (LUV) to $44 from $38 and keeps a Neutral rating on the shares. The firm updated targets in the airlines group as part of a Q4 earnings preview. Citi’s business travel barometer has bottomed, the analyst tells investors in a research note. However, the firm still expects the supermajors to issue “conservative” outlooks for 2026.
